intro: Crotalaria erlangeri, commonly known as the erlanger false nectarine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces seed pods that split open when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Crotalaria erlangeri is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
